Track information for the album Back to the Drawing Board. Preview the album in the Spotify player below or listen to the full album on on youtube music, Spotify, or itunes. There is also a YouTube playlist at the bottom of this page (and available here)

 

Back to the Drawing Board

Back to the Drawing Board is a 13 track album released in 2012. The official launch was in September 2012.

 

Rain

Vocals: Ciara McHugh
Backing Vocals: Cillian McHugh
Guitar: Cillian McHugh


The sky is grey, it’s raining today
Pearls on the grass
It’s always the same, drops of rain
But the tears keep falling down

Tears in your eyes, misty skies
Vision is blurred
Where is the pain, you can’t explain
Tears in the rain

Why do we cry?
Love or loss?

Drops on the glass trace a path
Of patterns and maps
Trickling down, from your frown
It tickles your cheek

It’s always the same, drops of rain
On the window pane
You wipe your eyes but continue to cry
And the rain falls

 

Bigness

Vocals: Cillian McHugh
Backing Vocals: Ciara McHugh
Guitars: Cillian McHugh
Organ: Ciara McHugh
Drums: Donal McHugh
Bass: Cillian McHugh


Look up to see, to see how high
can we ever reach the sky
what’ll i be before i die
and should i wonder why

start with one, another makes two
are the numbers really true
it can’t be done, if we only knew
to count them all: impossible to do

time goes on and on, every day we’re here
adds up to pass the year
when it’s done and gone you can’t go back
to change the past it doesn’t work like that

the universe expands that’s what they say
getting bigger every day
the big bang blew it all away
far and wide past the milky way

Stars

Vocals: Ciara McHugh, Cillian McHugh
Guitars: Cillian McHugh
Electric Piano: Donal McHugh
Drums: Donal McHugh
Bass: Cillian McHugh


I watch the sun go down:
Purple and red through the scattered clouds.
Golden light fills the sky.

Do you remember by the water?
Clouds in the way, sky was grey,
It didn’t matter.

I watch the darkness fall and surround us all.
Warmth and light
Are faded and gone.

Cold bite on a lonely night.
Chill in the air as I sit and stare

Stare at the sky for hours trying to count the stars.
So far away, so long ago
Does it matter?

Standing alone, under the moon’s glow
Empty night and the starlight.
Silver streak shines on your cheek as a star winks out.

 

Faith

Vocals: Cillian McHugh
Guitars: Cillian McHugh
Electric Piano: Donal McHugh
Drums: Donal McHugh
Bass: Cillian McHugh


What if I told you that everyone was wrong?
wrong in what they believe…
And what if I told you that everyone was right
right in what they believe … but wrong…?…

Would you call me mad if I told you right was wrong and wrong was right?

Good and Evil invented by men trying to explain what we cannot comprehend.
Don’t search for the answer ’cause it’s right there to be found… and not there… and right there.

Would you call me mad if I told you there’s no point? and that’s the point… so what’s the point?

Follow your heart and believe in what you believe… let it’s music reach you, just listen.
And live your life ’cause it’s all that you can know… take good with bad and let the balance flow.

Would you call me mad if I told you that I knew…?…and didn’t know…because I know…?..

 

24

Vocals: Ciara McHugh, Cillian McHugh
Guitars: Cillian McHugh
Drums: Donal McHugh
Bass: Cillian McHugh


Verse 1
Reverse the answer, It’s 24
But what is the question? No one cares anymore
God is Forgotten, Who needs heaven’s door
We’ve got money

Chorus
And the more we learn, Learn about the earth
The more we seem to forget
Technologies and good careers, we try to beat our peer
And 24 is all the time we get

Verse 2
The edge of the rainbow goes up to 24
On the other side we’re getting fried, more than ever before
Chainsaws and trucks expose the forest floor
And we let it happen

Chasing Rainbows

Vocals: Cillian McHugh
Guitar: Cillian McHugh


to love is to catch a rainbow
the sun and the rain, the joy and the pain

chase a rainbow
’till you catch the wind
and it carries you off
over the sky
washed up
left on the moon
broken hearts
chase rainbows

swirl for a while with a surface smile
but bubbles burst or float away on a breeze

chase a rainbow
’till you catch the wind
and it carries you off
over the sky
washed up
left on the moon
broken hearts
chase rainbows

 

Passing Days

Vocals: Ciara McHugh
Backing Vocals: Cillian McHugh
Guitar: Cillian McHugh


The days pass.
But your heart still cries
(But inside, inside it still rains)

 

Back to the Drawing Board

Vocals: Ciara McHugh
Backing Vocals: Cillian McHugh
Guitars: Cillian McHugh
Piano: Donal McHugh
Drums: Donal McHugh
Bass: Cillian McHugh



  Verse:                                                Bridge:
       G     C     G     C     G     C     G     C      Em D~ G  Am    F

Verse 1
paint a picture, write a song… to illustrate this life
the page is yours, your work your life… you do your best to get it right

but the colours start to run … words become undone

Chorus 1
cross it out
tear it up
erase it till there leaves no trace
and start again, start again

Verse 2
ealainteoir ar leathnach bán … dathanna an saol
amhran beo le mothúchán … focail don saol

ach theip an ghrá bhris an peann ní leor a bhí ann

Chorus 2
scrois é
chuir sa tine é
bris é go dtí píosaí beag
is tosaigh arís, tosaigh arís

Verse 3
start again on a brand new page … we all learn with age
peann nua, dathanna nua … ach an amhrán chéanna

nuair a theip an ghrá bhris an peann ní leor a bhí ann

Chorus 3
scrois é
chuir sa tine é
bris é go dtí píosaí beag
is tosaigh arís, tosaigh arís

 

The Price Of Love

Vocals: Cillian McHugh
Acoustic Guitar: Cillian McHugh
Electric Guitar: Maurice McHugh
Piano: Donal McHugh
Drums: Donal McHugh
Bass: Cillian McHugh
Harmonica: Cillian McHugh


Waiting… Holding out
Hoping time won’t run out
Torn between a rock and a hard place
Torn between love and happiness

Neither is enough, neither will suffice
Carry on the same - that’s the best advice
Hide from the shame, hide from your heart
Cause no pain, break no-one’s heart

 

Broken Words

Vocals: Ciara McHugh, Cillian McHugh
Guitars: Cillian McHugh
Drums: Donal McHugh
Bass: Cillian McHugh


You mean it. You say it’s true.
I believe it. I feel it too.
You said to me, I said to you.

Words pick me up and carry me.
The thrill, the rush, the waves under me.
(Surfing the waves)

But waves break words are lost.
Crashing truths of changing tides,
Washed ashore and left behind.

Words are washed out ripples on the shore.
(Washed out waves)
Broken words can’t carry me anymore.
(Broken, broken words)

You said it then.
Means nothing now.
Meaning lost.
(From your) Broken words.

 

The Happy Song

Vocals: Cillian McHugh
Guitars: Cillian McHugh
Piano: Donal McHugh
Drums: Donal McHugh
Bass: Cillian McHugh
Harmonica: Cillian McHugh



  Verse:
       G   Bm7 E7    G   Bm7 E7    G   Bm7 E7  A7    C   D7  G   B7

       G   Bm7 E7    A7 Am7 D D9D D7   G   Bm  Em  C9    C9 E~ E B  D  D7 D6 D

  A||-(2)--2---2--|--0--0-----------|-(2)--2---2---3--|--3--2--2--|-------------|
  E||--3-------0--|-----------------|--3-------0------|--------0--|-------------|

If i’ve got somethin’ to say i say it
If i’ve got something to do i do it
And i feel so good

Doesn’t even matter if the rains fall
And i Don’t care if there’s no sun at all
Coz i feel good

Some things that happen you cannot change
What reason why?
But if i’m ever feelin down
I know

Nothing can be thrown at me i cannot catch
all obstacles can be overcome
and even if i feel alone
i know

i’ve got my friends
there’ll always be someone to call on
someone to cheer me up

when i’m happy i’m with friends
and when i’m with friends i’m happyv and i believe

 

Too Close

Vocals: Cillian McHugh
Guitars: Cillian McHugh
Piano: Donal McHugh
Drums: Donal McHugh
Bass: Cillian McHugh
Harmonica: Cillian McHugh


Listening to the silence of chords that were never played
Humming through the lines of mistakes we made
Listening while we wait is it too late

The final words he spoke still echoed in your mind
Oh as a song comes to a close for a second time
True for you now, wondering how

 

Sun

Vocals: Ciara McHugh
Backing Vocals: Cillian McHugh
Guitar: Cillian McHugh


Kids are playin’ on the grass,
The sun is out, the rain has passed.
But the sun can’t warm the void inside
When you’re all alone.

Outside the window, bright and blue,
The empty sky is reflected through.
Through your eyes and into you,
Just the same.

The sun shines.
Burning inside.

A gentle breeze shakes the leaves
As it blows through the trees.
From deep inside you breathe a sigh,
Wondering why.

The sun is bright the sky is clear.
You’re all alone, there’s no one here.
Hurting inside you fight the tears,
And the sun shines.

Listen on YouTube

 

Cillian McHugh, 2025
